intro: Androsace darvasica, commonly known as the Darvasica sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in early summer. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to thrive in arid and rocky environments. Androsace darvasica is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
